articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of embattled developer China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) plunged 25% on Monday after police detained some staff at its wealth management unit, suggesting a new investigation that could add to the property company's woes.
articles.title: China Evergrande shares tumble 25% after wealth management staff detained

articles.author: Yu Xie
articles.description: Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden (2007.HK) faces yet another liquidity test with Monday's deadline to pay $15 million in interest linked to an offshore bond after having dodged default at the last minute twice earlier this month.
articles.title: Cash-squeezed developer Country Garden faces another dollar coupon deadline

articles.author: Chandni Shah
articles.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan asked Tesla (TSLA.O) CEO Elon Musk to build a Tesla factory in Turkey, Anadolu Agency posted on social media platform X on Sunday.
articles.title: Erdogan asks Musk to build Tesla factory in Turkey

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United Auto Workers strike against the Detroit Three automakers entered its third day on Sunday with no immediate resolution on the horizon.
articles.title: UAW strike against automakers enters third day, no resolution seen

articles.author: Andy Bruce
articles.description: The Bank of England is likely to hike interest rates once again this week, possibly the last hurrah for one of the great tightening cycles of the last 100 years as a cooling economy begins to worry policymakers.
articles.title: Bank of England readies what may be its final rate hike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean Internet service provider SK Broadband said on Monday it is ending all disputes with Netflix Inc (NFLX.O), after the firms engaged in lawsuits on whether Netflix must pay for costs from increased network traffic and maintenance work.
articles.title: S.Korean broadband firm says it is ending all disputes with Netflix

articles.author: Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore's annual exports fell for an 11th straight month in August as the trade-reliant economy continues to grapple with global headwinds on inflation and declining demand.
articles.title: Singapore's non-oil exports fall for a 11th month in August

articles.author: Belén Carreño
articles.description: The European Union could become as dependent on China for lithium-ion batteries and fuel cells by 2030 as it was on Russia for energy before the war in Ukraine unless it takes strong measures, a paper prepared for EU leaders said.
articles.title: Exclusive: EU may become as hooked on China batteries as it was on Russian energy

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump said he dismissed the views of his own lawyers in continuing to challenge his 2020 defeat because he did not respect them, saying in an interview aired on Sunday that he had made up his own mind that the election had been "rigged" - a false claim that he continues to make.
articles.title: Trump says it was his decision to persist with 2020 election challenges

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: A spring heat wave across large parts of Australia's southeast, including Sydney, will intensify on Monday, the weather bureau said, with temperatures expected to peak up to 16 degrees Celsius (60 Fahrenheit) above the September average.
articles.title: Australia swelters in spring heat wave, temperatures set to break records
